definition: to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
mold/die/matrix/pattern
to imitate/model/norm/pattern
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
manner/pattern/way/appearance/shape/classifier: kind, type

sentences.english: You've postured until everyone's sick of you.
sentences.chinese: 你裝模作樣，直到大家都討厭你。

sentences.english: Smugness, embarrassment and fear can all cause smiles.
sentences.chinese: 裝模作樣，尷尬和害怕都能使人微笑。

sentences.english: We always felt she was playacting.
sentences.chinese: 我們總覺得她在裝模作樣。
她是個裝模作樣的女孩。

sentences.english: I am sometimes accused of being an inveterate poseur .
sentences.chinese: 有時有人說我慣於裝模作樣。
她那裝模作樣勁兒真令人作嘔。
裝模作樣勁兒真令人作嘔。

sentences.english: When it comes to EU diplomacy Germany does not do histrionics.
sentences.chinese: 在歐盟外交方面德國從不裝模作樣。

sentences.english: In the hall, an eye then saw the affectation of the priests.
sentences.chinese: 進了會場，皓月一眼便看到了那個裝模作樣的道士。

sentences.english: In the living room, there were a band of people dancing in group affectedly , which was very farcical.
sentences.chinese: 客廳裏一幫人在裝模作樣地跳集體舞，我覺得很好笑。

sentences.english: The question Is this playacting or does he really hate us?
sentences.chinese: 他到底是裝模作樣還是真的恨我們？

definition: a lie/untrue statement/misstatement
to show off/to make a display of
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to have no sense of shame
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
double standard
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
to be cynical/to be embittered
